title: Sampler, 1785
medium:
Medium: silk and wool embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, satin, stem, chain, feather, Rumanian, buttonhole, surface satin, half cross, and eyelet stitches on plain weave foundation
provenance: Ex. coll. Gertrude Oppenheimer. Donor bought at antique show in 1943 for $45.
description: The center field contains bands of alphabets and numerals embroidered in black with the inscription Peggy Dodges Sampler. A wide border contains flowering plants, baskets of flowers, butterflies, female figures, and a house in a landscape, embroidered in many colors and with the ground fabric completely covered.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1785.
1785. Medium: silk and wool embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, satin, stem, chain, feather, Rumanian, buttonhole, surface satin, half cross, and eyelet stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-153-a,b.
